Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43.server.network

Class ClientListener

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43.server.network.ClientListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ClientListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
ClientListener is the server network handler

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientListener

      public ClientListener​(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Not-default constructor for the ClientListener class.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - is the socket that is opened between a client and this ClientListener

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Override of the run method, here the ClientListener creates and starts the connection detector to keep the connection active and after that it listens for messages form the client for all the match
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • receive

      public ClientMessage receive() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Method that receives messages and if it is not a PingMessage, the receive method handles the message and returns it or puts it in the stackMessages ArrayList.
      Returns:
      The message arrived from the Client.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - occurs when you try to load a class at run time using Class .forName() or loadClass() methods and mentioned classes are not found in the classpath.
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread that is running is stopped.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(java.lang.Object message)
      Method used to send messages to the client.
      Parameters:
      message - The message that will be sent.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(EndGameMessage message)
      Method used to send EndGameMessages. After the delivery it calls the handleDisconnection method.
      Parameters:
      message - is the EndGameMessage that will be sent

    • handleMessage

      public void handleMessage​(ClientMessage message)
      This method checks the kind of message and then if it is a RegistrationMessage it creates and starts a RegisterClientListener, that is a thread for the registration in a match.
      Parameters:
      message - The message that is received from the "receive" method.

    • pushMessageOnStack

      public void pushMessageOnStack​(ClientMessage clientMessage) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      This method is used to push a message on the stack of the ClientListener when it arrives. In that way I notify the thread that was waiting for a response from the client.
      Parameters:
      clientMessage - The message arrived from the client.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread that is running is stopped.

    • popMessageFromStack

      public ClientMessage popMessageFromStack()
      Getter method for a single message in the stackMessages ArrayList.
      Returns:
      the first message in the stackMessages

    • flushStack

      public void flushStack()
      This method is used to flush all the messages from the stack when it is necessary.

    • handleDisconnection

      public void handleDisconnection​(boolean isFirstToDisconnect, LeaveGameMessage.TypeDisconnectionHeader typeDisconnectionHeader)
      This method is used to handle a disconnection in different ways, regarding different scenarios. 1) The client has "killed" the program. So he won't be available anymore. In this case the method will close the socket, put a LeaveGameMessage in the stack and start the process of disconnection through RegisterClientListener; 2) The client was a player in a game that ended. In this case the client will be still available. For this reason the socket won't be closed. If the client has been the first to disconnect, he will start the process of disconnection through the RegisterClientListener.
      Parameters:
      isFirstToDisconnect - Boolean that is true if the player has been the first to disconnect, false otherwise.
      typeDisconnectionHeader - It is the type of disconnection happened that made the player leave the game.

    • setIdGame

      public void setIdGame​(java.lang.Integer idGame)
      Setter method for the integer variable idGame, that will be the reference of the game for the ClientListener.
      Parameters:
      idGame - is the identifier of the match.

    • isDisconnected

      public boolean isDisconnected()
      Getter method for the boolean variable disconnected. When this variable becomes true this thread and the ConnectionDetector thread are stopped.
      Returns:
      The value of the boolean disconnected. It is true if the connection from the client was lost, true otherwise.
